          require 'set'
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          1
          
          module Ai4r
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          1
          
            module GeneticAlgorithm
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
              class GeneticSearchWithOptions < GeneticSearch
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
                def initialize(initial_population_size, generations, options = {})
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          2
          
                  @population_size = initial_population_size
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          2
          
                  @max_generation = generations
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          2
          
                  @generation = 0
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          2
          
                  @options = options
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          2
          
                  @chromosomeClass = options[:class]
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
                def generate_initial_population
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          2
          
                 @population = []
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          2
          
                 puts "INIT: TARGETS: #{@options[:targets]}"
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          2
          
                 puts "INIT: REAL: #{@options[:real_prosumption]}" unless @options[:real_prosumption].nil?
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          2
          
                 @options[:stats] ||= {}
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          2
          
                 @options[:stats][:start_run] = Time.now
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          2
          
                 puts "The class is #{@chromosomeClass}"
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          2
          
                 @population_size.times do
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          400
          
                   population << @chromosomeClass.seed(@options)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                 end
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                end
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                # We combine each pair of selected chromosome using the method
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                # Chromosome.reproduce
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                #
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                # The reproduction will also call the Chromosome.mutate method with
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                # each member of the population. You should implement Chromosome.mutate
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                # to only change (mutate) randomly. E.g. You could effectivly change the
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # chromosome only if
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                #     rand < ((1 - chromosome.normalized_fitness) * 0.4)
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          1
          
                def reproduction(selected_to_breed)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          200
          
                  offsprings = []
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          200
          
                  0.upto(selected_to_breed.length/2-1) do |i|
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          13200
          
                    offsprings << @chromosomeClass.reproduce(selected_to_breed[2*i], selected_to_breed[2*i+1])
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  end
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          200
          
                  @population.each do |individual|
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          40000
          
                    @chromosomeClass.mutate(individual)
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                  end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          200
          
                  return offsprings
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                end
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
          
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                #     1. Choose initial population
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                #     2. Evaluate the fitness of each individual in the population
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                #     3. Repeat
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                #           1. Select best-ranking individuals to reproduce
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                #           2. Breed new generation through crossover and mutation (genetic operations) and give birth to offspring
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                #           3. Evaluate the individual fitnesses of the offspring
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                #           4. Replace worst ranked part of population with offspring
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                #     4. Until termination
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                #     5. Return the best chromosome
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          1
          
                def run
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          2
          
                  generate_initial_population                    #Generate initial population
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          2
          
                  @max_generation.times do |i|
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          200
          
                    message = "Generation: #{i}, best fitness: #{@population[0].fitness}"
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          200
          
                    @options[:stats][:gen] ||= []
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          200
          
                    @options[:stats][:gen][i] = {
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                        fitness: @population[0].fitness,
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                        time: Time.now - @options[:stats][:start_run]
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                    }
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          200
          
                    puts message
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          200
          
                    unless @options[:rb_channel].nil?
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                      @options[:rb_channel].publish({data: message, event: 'output'}.to_json)
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                    end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
          
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          200
          
                    selected_to_breed = selection                #Evaluates current population
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          200
          
                    offsprings = reproduction selected_to_breed  #Generate the population for this new generation
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          200
          
                    replace_worst_ranked offsprings
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  end
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          2
          
                  return best_chromosome
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                end
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
              end
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
              # A Chromosome is a representation of an individual solution for a specific 
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
              # problem. You will have to redifine the Chromosome representation for each
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
              # particular problem, along with its fitness, mutate, reproduce, and seed 
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              # methods.
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          1
          
              class StaticChromosome < Chromosome
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
          
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          1
          
                attr_accessor :data
        
      99.

          1
          
                attr_accessor :normalized_fitness
        
      100.

          1
          
                attr_accessor :options
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
          
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          1
          
                def initialize(data, options)
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                  # puts "data, options: #{data}, #{options[:errors].length}"
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
          
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          6800
          
                  if options.nil?
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    puts Thread.current.backtrace.join("\n")
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                    Thread.exit
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                  end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
          
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          6800
          
                  @data = data
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          6800
          
                  @options = options
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          6800
          
                  @errors = options[:errors]

    114. 
          6800
          
                  @prosumer_ids = options[:prosumer_ids]
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                end
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                # The fitness method quantifies the optimality of a solution 
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                # (that is, a chromosome) in a genetic algorithm so that that particular 
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                # chromosome may be ranked against all the other chromosomes. 
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                # 
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                # Optimal chromosomes, or at least chromosomes which are more optimal, 
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                # are allowed to breed and mix their datasets by any of several techniques, 
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                # producing a new generation that will (hopefully) be even better.
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          1
          
                def fitness
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          147201
          
                  return @fitness if @fitness
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          40800
          
                  cls = (options[:kappa]).times.map { |i| [] }
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          2998800
          
                  @data.each_with_index { |g, i| cls[g].push i}
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          40800
          
                  p_b2 = cls.map { |c| penalty_before(c) }
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          40800
          
                  p_a2 = cls.map { |c| penalty_after(c) }
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          6800
          
                  impr2 = p_b2.zip(p_a2).map do |b,a|
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          34000
          
                    b > 0 ? ((b - a)/b) : 0
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                  end.inject(0,:+)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          6800
          
                  @fitness = impr2
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                end
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          1
          
                def penalty_before(cluster)
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          34000
          
                  @cache_penalty_before ||= {}
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          34000
          
                  @cache_penalty_before[cluster] ||= cluster.map do |p|
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          2992000
          
                    @options[:penalties_before][p]
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                  end.inject(0,:+)
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                end
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          1
          
                def penalty_after(cluster)
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          34000
          
                  @cache_penalty_after||= {}
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          34000
          
                  @cache_penalty_after[cluster] ||= @options[:timestamps].map do |t|
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                    v = cluster.map do |p|
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                      @errors[[@prosumer_ids[p] ,t]] || 0
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                    end.inject(0,:+)
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    self.class.penalty(v, @options)
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                  end.inject(0,:+)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                # mutation method is used to maintain genetic diversity from one 
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                # generation of a population of chromosomes to the next. It is analogous 
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                # to biological mutation. 
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                # 
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                # The purpose of mutation in GAs is to allow the 
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                # algorithm to avoid local minima by preventing the population of 
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                # chromosomes from becoming too similar to each other, thus slowing or even 
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                # stopping evolution.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                # 
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                # Calling the mutate function will "probably" slightly change a chromosome
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                # randomly. 
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                #
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                # This implementation of "mutation" will (probably) reverse the 
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                # order of 2 consecutive randome nodes 
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                # (e.g. from [ 0, 1, 2, 4] to [0, 2, 1, 4]) if:
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                #     ((1 - chromosome.normalized_fitness) * 0.4)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          1
          
                def self.mutate(chromosome)
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          20000
          
                  if chromosome.normalized_fitness && rand < ((1 - chromosome.normalized_fitness) * 0.3)
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                    data = chromosome.data
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                    index = rand(data.length-1)
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                    data[index], data[index+1] = data[index+1], data[index]
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                    chromosome.data = data
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                    @fitness = nil
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                end
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
          
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                # Reproduction method is used to combine two chromosomes (solutions) into 
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                # a single new chromosome. There are several ways to
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                # combine two chromosomes: One-point crossover, Two-point crossover,
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                # "Cut and splice", edge recombination, and more. 
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                # 
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                # The method is usually dependant of the problem domain.
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                # In this case, we have implemented edge recombination, wich is the 
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                # most used reproduction algorithm for the Travelling salesman problem.
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          1
          
                def self.reproduce(a, b)
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
          
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                  #Two point crossover
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          6600
          
                  current = rand(2)
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          6600
          
                  point1 = rand(a.data.length)
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          6600
          
                  point2 = rand(a.data.length)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
          #        puts "reproduce, #{point1}, #{point2}"
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          6600
          
                  spawn = a.data.zip(b.data).map.with_index do |g, i|
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          2904000
          
                    current = 1 - current if (i == point1) ^ (i == point2)
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                 #    puts "#{g[0]},#{g[1]},#{i},#{current}, #{g[current]}"
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          2904000
          
                    g[current]
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                  end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
          
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
          
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                  # The following is uniform crossover
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                  # spawn = a.data.zip(b.data).map do |g1 ,g2|
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                  #   rand(2) > 0 ? g1 : g2
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                  # end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          6600
          
                  return self.new(spawn, a.options)
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                end
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
          
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                # Initializes an individual solution (chromosome) for the initial 
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                # population. Usually the chromosome is generated randomly, but you can 
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                # use some problem domain knowledge, to generate a 
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                # (probably) better initial solution.
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          1
          
                def self.seed(options)
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                  # puts "#{options}"
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          200
          
                  data_size = options[:prosumer_ids].length
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          200
          
                  kappa = options[:kappa]
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
          
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          200
          
                  seed = []
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          200
          
                  0.upto(data_size-1) do
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          88000
          
                    seed << rand(kappa)
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  end
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          200
          
                  options[:timestamps] = options[:errors].map{|(pid,t), v| t}.to_set
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          200
          
                  options[:penalties_before] = options[:prosumer_ids].map do |pid|
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                    options[:timestamps].map do |t|
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                      penalty(options[:errors][[pid, t]] || 0, options)
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          88000
          
                    end.inject(0, :+)
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                  end
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                  # puts "seed options: #{options[:errors].length}, timestamps: #{options[:timestamps]}, pb: #{options[:penalties_before]}"
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          200
          
                  return self.new(seed, options)
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                end
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          1
          
                def self.set_cost_matrix(costs)
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                  @@costs = costs
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                end
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
          
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          1
          
                private
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          1
          
                def self.penalty(error, options)
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                  (error > 0 ? options[:penalty_violation] : options[:penalty_satisfaction]) * error.abs
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                end
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
              end
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
          
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          1
          
              class StaticChromosomeWithSmartCrossover < StaticChromosome
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          1
          
                def self.reproduce(a, b)
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                  clusters = create_clusters(a,b)
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                  spawn = a.data.map { |p| a.options[:kappa]- 1 }
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                  0.upto(a.options[:kappa] - 2) do |cluster_index|
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                 #    puts "a: #{a.data}, b:#{b.data}, spawn: #{spawn}, CLUSTERS: #{clusters}"
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                    best = clusters.sort_by do |c|
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                      before = a.penalty_before(c)
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                      after = a.penalty_after(c)
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                      before > 0 ? (before - after) / before : 0
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                    end.last
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                    clusters -= [best]
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                    best.each do |p|
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                      spawn[p] = cluster_index
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                      clusters.each{|c| c.delete p}
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                    end
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                    clusters.reject!{|c| c.size == 0}
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                  end
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                 #  puts "#{spawn }"
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  return self.new(spawn, a.options)
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                end
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
          
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          1
          
                private
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
          
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
          
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          1
          
                def self.create_clusters(a, b)
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                  clusters = (2 * a.options[:kappa]).times.map { |i| [] }
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                  a.data.each_with_index { |g, i| clusters[g].push i}
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                  b.data.each_with_index { |g, i| clusters[g + a.options[:kappa]].push i}
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                  clusters
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                end
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
          
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              end
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
          
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
            end
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
          end
        
      286.

    lib/clustering/clustering_module.rb

    89.39 % covered

    132 relevant lines. 118 lines covered and 14 lines missed.

          1
          
          require 'clustering/genetic_error_clustering2'
        
      2.

          1
          
          require 'clustering/spectral_clustering'
        
      3.

    4. 
          
          
          
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # This module implements the clustering algorithms for the demo
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
          module ClusteringModule
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
            def self.algorithms
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              {
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                  energy_type: {
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                      string: 'By renewable type',
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          2
          
                      proc: ->(k) { run_energy_type k }
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                  },
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                  building_type: {
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                      string: 'By building type',
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          2
          
                      proc: ->(k) { run_building_type k }
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                  },
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                  connection_type: {
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                      string: 'By connection type',
        
      20.

          2

      29.

                  genetic: {

          1
          
            def self.run_algorithm(params)
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          13
          
              result = self.algorithms.with_indifferent_access[params["algorithm"]][:proc].call(params)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          82
          
              result.select { |cl| cl.prosumers.size > 0 }
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            end
        
      99.

          1
          
            def self.run_energy_type(params)
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          2
          
              result = {}
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          2
          
              cl = TempCluster.new name: 'No ren.',
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                               description: 'No info about renewable energy.'
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          2
          
              result[:none] = cl
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          2
          
              EnergyType.all.each do |et|
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          4
          
                cl = TempCluster.new name: "CL: #{et.name}",
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                                 description: "Prosumers with primarily #{et.name} "\
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                                              'energy production'
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          4
          
                result[et.id] = cl
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
              end
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
          
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          2
          
              Prosumer.category(ProsumerCategory.find params["category"]).each do |p|
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          74
          
                etp = p.energy_type_prosumers.order('power DESC').first
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          74
          
                if etp.nil?
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          74
          
                  result[:none].prosumers.push(p)
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                else
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  etid = etp.energy_type.id
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  result[etid].prosumers.push(p)
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
              end
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
          
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          2
          
              result.values
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          
        
      127.

          1
          
            def self.run_connection_type(params)
        
      128.

          2
          
              cat = ProsumerCategory.find params["category"]
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          2
          
              result = []
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          2
          
              cl = TempCluster.new name: 'No con. info.',

    131. 
          
          
                               description: 'No connection info.'
        
      132.

          2
          
              cl.prosumers << Prosumer.where(connection_type: nil, prosumer_category: params["category"])
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          2
          
              result.push(cl)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135.

          2
          
              ConnectionType.all.each do |bt|
        
      136.

    137.

    138. 
          
          
          
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          14
          
                cl.prosumers << Prosumer.where(connection_type: bt, prosumer_category: params["category"])
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          14

      141.

      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          1
          
            def self.get_centroid(cluster)
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          55
          
              sum_x = 0
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          55
          
              sum_y = 0
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          55
          
              count = 0
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          55
          
              cluster.prosumers.each do |p|
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                fail 'Found prosumer without location' if p.location_x.nil? ||
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          343
          
                                                          p.location_y.nil?
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          343
          
                sum_x += p.location_x
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          343
          
                sum_y += p.location_y
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          343
          
                count += 1
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
              end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
              {
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                x: sum_x / count,
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                y: sum_y / count,
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                cluster: cluster
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          55
          
              }
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          1
          
            def self.get_centroid_dr(cluster, dr_vector)
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
              {
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                  dr: cluster.map {|p| dr_vector[p]}.sum / cluster.size,
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                  cluster: cluster
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
              }
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
            end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
          
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          1
          
            def self.distance(prosumer, centroid)
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          1665
          
              (prosumer.location_x - centroid[:x])**2 +
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          3330
          
                (prosumer.location_y - centroid[:y])**2
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
            end
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
          
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          1
          
            def self.find_closest(prosumer, centroids)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          333
          
              min = Float::MAX
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          333
          
              closest = nil
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          333
          
              centroids.each do |centroid|
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          1665
          
                d = distance(prosumer, centroid)
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          1665
          
                if d < min
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          658
          
                  min = d
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          658
          
                  closest = centroid[:cluster]
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                end
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
              end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          333
          
              closest
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
            end
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          1
          
            def self.find_closest_dr(dr, centroids)
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              (centroids.min_by do |c|
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                (c[:dr] - dr).abs
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
              end)[:cluster]
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
            end
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          1
          
            def self.run_location(params)
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          2
          
              cat = ProsumerCategory.find(params["category"].first.to_i)
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              # puts "Category is: #{params["category"]}, ------- #{cat}"
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          2
          
              result = Prosumer.with_locations.category(cat).sample(params["kappa"].to_i).map.with_index do |p, i|
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          10
          
                cl = TempCluster.new name: "Loc: #{i}",
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                                 description: "Location based cluster #{i}."
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          10
          
                cl.prosumers.push p
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          10
          
                cl
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
              end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
          
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          12
          
              centroids = result.map { |cl| get_centroid(cl) }
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          2
          
              loop do
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          9
          
                old_centroids = Array.new(centroids)
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          54
          
                result.each { |cl| cl.prosumers.clear }
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          9
          
                Prosumer.with_locations.category(cat).each do |p|
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          333
          
                  find_closest(p, centroids).prosumers.push p
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                end
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          54
          
                centroids = result.map { |cl| get_centroid(cl) }
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          9
          
                break if centroids <=> old_centroids
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
              end
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
          
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          2
          
              without_location = Prosumer.category(cat) - Prosumer.with_locations.category(cat)
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
          
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          2
          
              if without_location.count > 0
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                cl = TempCluster.new name: 'No loc.',
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                                 description: 'Prosumers with no Location info available.'
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                cl.prosumers << without_location
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                result.push cl
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
              end
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          2
          
              result
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
            end
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
          
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          1
          
            def self.run_dr(params)
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          1
          
              cat = ProsumerCategory.find(params["category"].first.to_i)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          1
          
              range = params["startDate"] .. params["endDate"]
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          1
          
              result = Prosumer.category(cat).with_positive_dr(range).sample(params["kappa"].to_i).map.with_index do |p, i|
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                 [ p.id ]
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
              end
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
          
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          38
          
              dr_vector = Hash[Prosumer.category(cat).map {|p| [p.id, p.max_dr(range)]}]
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
          
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          1
          
              dr_prosumers = Prosumer.category(cat).with_dr(range)
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
          
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          1
          
              centroids = result.map { |cl| get_centroid_dr(cl, dr_vector) }
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          1
          
              loop do
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          1
          
                old_centroids = Array.new centroids
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          1
          
                Rails.logger.debug "Old centroids: #{old_centroids}"
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          1
          
                result.each { |cl| cl.clear }
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          1
          
                dr_prosumers.each do |p|
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                  cl = find_closest_dr(dr_vector[p.id], centroids)
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                  cl.push p.id
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                end
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          1
          
                result = result.select { |cl| cl.size > 0}
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          1
          
                centroids = result.map { |cl| get_centroid_dr cl, dr_vector }
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          1
          
                break if centroids <=> old_centroids
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
              end
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
          
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          1
          
              without_dr = Prosumer.category(cat) - dr_prosumers
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          1
          
              if without_dr.count > 0
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          1

            module GeneticAlgorithm

              # A Chromosome is a representation of an individual solution for a specific
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              # problem. You will have to redifine the Chromosome representation for each
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              # particular problem, along with its fitness, mutate, reproduce, and seed 
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              # methods.
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
              class DynamicChromosome < Chromosome
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
                attr_accessor :data
        
      20.

          1
          
                attr_accessor :normalized_fitness

          1
          
                attr_accessor :options

                def initialize(data, options)
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  # puts "data, options: #{data}, #{options[:errors].length}"
        
      25. 
      
        
    25.

    26.

    27. 
          
          
                  if options.nil?
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                    puts Thread.current.backtrace.join("\n")
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                    Thread.exit
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                  end
        
      31. 
      
        
    31.

                  @data = data

                  @real_consumption = options[:real_consumption]
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                  @prosumers = options[:prosumers]

                  @initial_imballance = options[:initial_imballance]
        
      38. 
      
        
    38.

    39. 
          
          
              #    puts "TARGETS: #{@targets_per_cluster}"

              #    puts "REAL: #{@targets_per_cluster}"
        
      41.

                end
        
      42.

    43. 
          
          
                # The fitness method quantifies the optimality of a solution 
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                # (that is, a chromosome) in a genetic algorithm so that that particular 
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                # chromosome may be ranked against all the other chromosomes. 
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # 
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                # Optimal chromosomes, or at least chromosomes which are more optimal, 
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                # are allowed to breed and mix their datasets by any of several techniques, 
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                # producing a new generation that will (hopefully) be even better.
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
                def fitness
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  return @fitness if @fitness
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
          
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  consumption_per_cluster = {}
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                  @data.each_with_index do |v, i|
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                    consumption_per_cluster[v] ||= 0
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                    # puts @prosumers[i].id, @real_consumption
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                    consumption_per_cluster[v] += (@real_consumption[@prosumers[i].id] || 0)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                  end
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  total_penalties_before = @initial_imballance.map do |imballance|
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                    penalty(imballance)
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                  end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
          
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  total_penalties_after = 0
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  res = 0;
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                  consumption_per_cluster.each do |cluster, consumption |
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    #  puts "DEBUG: #{cluster}, #{consumption}"
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                    p = penalty((consumption || 0) - (@targets_per_cluster[cluster] || 0))
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                    res += 100 * (total_penalties_before[cluster] - p) / total_penalties_before[cluster] if total_penalties_before[cluster] > 0
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                  @fitness =  res
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
          
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                # mutation method is used to maintain genetic diversity from one 
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                # generation of a population of chromosomes to the next. It is analogous 
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                # to biological mutation. 
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                # 
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                # The purpose of mutation in GAs is to allow the 
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                # algorithm to avoid local minima by preventing the population of 
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                # chromosomes from becoming too similar to each other, thus slowing or even 
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                # stopping evolution.
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                # 
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                # Calling the mutate function will "probably" slightly change a chromosome
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                # randomly. 
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                #
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                # This implementation of "mutation" will (probably) reverse the 
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                # order of 2 consecutive randome nodes 
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                # (e.g. from [ 0, 1, 2, 4] to [0, 2, 1, 4]) if:
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                #     ((1 - chromosome.normalized_fitness) * 0.4)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          1
          
                def self.mutate(chromosome)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  if chromosome.normalized_fitness && rand < ((1 - chromosome.normalized_fitness) * 0.3)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                    data = chromosome.data
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                    index = rand(data.length-1)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    data[index], data[index+1] = data[index+1], data[index]
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                    chromosome.data = data
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                    @fitness = nil
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                  end
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                end
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
          
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                # Reproduction method is used to combine two chromosomes (solutions) into 
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                # a single new chromosome. There are several ways to
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                # combine two chromosomes: One-point crossover, Two-point crossover,
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                # "Cut and splice", edge recombination, and more. 
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                # 
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                # The method is usually dependant of the problem domain.
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                # In this case, we have implemented edge recombination, wich is the 
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                # most used reproduction algorithm for the Travelling salesman problem.
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
                def self.reproduce(a, b)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
          
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  #Two point crossover
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  current = rand(2)
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                  point1 = rand(a.data.length)
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  point2 = rand(a.data.length)
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
          #        puts "reproduce, #{point1}, #{point2}"
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                  spawn = a.data.zip(b.data).map.with_index do |g, i|
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                    current = 1 - current if (i == point1) ^ (i == point2)
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                 #    puts "#{g[0]},#{g[1]},#{i},#{current}, #{g[current]}"
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                    g[current]
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                  end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
          
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                  # The following is uniform crossover
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                  # spawn = a.data.zip(b.data).map do |g1 ,g2|
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                  #   rand(2) > 0 ? g1 : g2
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                  # end
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                  return DynamicChromosome.new(spawn, a.options)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                end
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
          
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                # Initializes an individual solution (chromosome) for the initial 
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                # population. Usually the chromosome is generated randomly, but you can 
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                # use some problem domain knowledge, to generate a 
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                # (probably) better initial solution.
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          1
          
                def self.seed(options)
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
          
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                #  puts "I am in the corrext seed function, options: #{options}"
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  data_size = options[:prosumers].length
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                  kappa = options[:kappa]
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                  seed = []
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  0.upto(data_size-1) do
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                    seed << rand(kappa)
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                  end
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                 #  puts "seed options: #{options[:errors].length}"
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                  return DynamicChromosome.new(seed, options)
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                end
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          1
          
                def self.set_cost_matrix(costs)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                  @@costs = costs
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                end
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
          
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          1
          
                private
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          1
          
                def penalty(error)
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  (error > 0 ? @options[:penalty_violation] : @options[:penalty_satisfaction]) * error.abs
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
              end
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            end
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
          
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          end
        
      167.

    lib/clustering/evaluate.rb

          require 'csv'
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          1
          
          require 'market/market'

    3. 
          1
          
          require "clustering/dynamic_chromosome"
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
          require "clustering/ai4r_modifications"
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
          module ClusteringModule
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          1
          
            class Evaluator
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
              def initialize(clusters: Cluster.all,
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                             startDate: Time.now - 1.month,
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                             endDate: Time.now,
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                             interval: 1.week,

              def evaluate

                          csv2 << [ i ] + penalties.map{|p| p[1]}
        
      46.

                          csv3 << [ i ] + penalties.map{|p| p[2]}

              def all_penalty_reductions(clusters, sd, ed)

    58. 
          
          
                if @adaptive
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                  get_dynamic_getnalty_reduction(@clusters, sd, ed)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                else
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                  @clusters.map{|c| get_penalty_reduction(c.prosumers, sd, ed)}

      63.

              def get_stats(prosumers, startDate, endDate)
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                Hash[
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    Market::Calculator.new(prosumers: prosumers,
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                                           startDate: startDate,
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                                           endDate: endDate)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                        .calcCosts[:disaggregated]
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                        .select { |d| d[:id] < 0 }
        
      73.

                        .map { |d| [d[:id], d.dup.update(penalty: d[:real] - d[:ideal])] }
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                ]
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
              end
        
      76.

              def get_penalty(prosumers, timestamp, target)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                Market::Calculator.new(prosumers: prosumers,
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                                       startDate: timestamp,
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                                       endDate: timestamp)
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                    .penalty_for_single(target)
        
      82.

      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
          
        
      85.

          1
          
              def get_penalty_reduction(prosumers, startDate, endDate)
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                stats = get_stats(prosumers, startDate, endDate)
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          #       puts JSON.pretty_generate stats
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
          
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
          #       [stats[-2][1][:penalty], stats[-1][1][:penalty]]
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                [
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                    stats[-1][:penalty],
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                    stats[-2][:penalty],
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                    stats[-1][:penalty] > 0 ?
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                        ((stats[-1][:penalty] - stats[-2][:penalty]) /
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                            stats[-1][:penalty] * 100) :
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                        "NaN"
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                ]
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
              end
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
          
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          1
          
              def get_targets(clusters, ts)
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                result = clusters.map do |c, i|
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                  DataPoint.where(prosumer: c.prosumers.map{|p| p.id},
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                                  interval: 2,
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                                  f_timestamp: ts)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                      .select("f_timestamp, prosumer_id, COALESCE(f_consumption,0) - COALESCE(f_production,0) as f_prosumption")
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                      .sum(:f_prosumption)
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                end
        
      108.

                puts "TARGET first: #{result}"
        
      109.

                result
        
      110.

              def get_real_before_reclustering(clusters, ts)

      115.

      116.

              def get_imballance_before(clusters, ts)
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                target = get_targets(clusters, ts)
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                before = get_real_before_reclustering(clusters, ts)
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                before.zip(target).map do |b,t|
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                  b - t
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                end
        
      132.

              end
        
      133.

          1
          
              def real_consumption(clusters, ts)
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                result = Hash[DataPoint.where(prosumer: clusters.map{|tc| tc.prosumers}.flatten,
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                                     interval: 2,
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                                     timestamp: ts)
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                                  .select("timestamp, prosumer_id, COALESCE(consumption,0) - COALESCE(production,0) as prosumption")
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                                  .map do |dp|
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  [dp.prosumer_id, dp.prosumption]
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                end]
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                puts "result: #{result}"
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                result
        
      144.

      145.

      146.
