          1
          
              def get_dynamic_getnalty_reduction(clusters, sd, ed)
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                all_prosumers = clusters.map{|tc| tc.prosumers}.flatten
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
          
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                penalties_before = clusters.map do |cl|
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                               get_stats(cl.prosumers, sd, ed)[-1][:penalty]
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                             end
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                puts JSON.pretty_generate penalties_before
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
          
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                penalties_after = (((sd.beginning_of_hour.to_i ..
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                    (ed - 1.hour).beginning_of_hour.to_i).step(1.hour).map do |t|
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                  ts = Time.at(t)
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
          
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  targets = get_targets(clusters, ts)
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                  search = Ai4r::GeneticAlgorithm::GeneticSearchWithOptions.new(
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                      200, 100, prosumers: all_prosumers,
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                      kappa: clusters.count,
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                      penalty_violation: 0.3, penalty_satisfaction: 0.2,
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                      class: Ai4r::GeneticAlgorithm::DynamicChromosome,
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                      targets: targets,
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                      initial_imballance: get_imballance_before(clusters, ts),
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                      real_consumption: real_consumption(clusters, ts)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                  )
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  best = search.run
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                  puts "NEW CLUSTERING: #{best.data.zip(all_prosumers).map {|c,p| [p.id, c]}}"
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
          
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  result = penalties_before.map{|k| []}
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                  best.data.each_with_index do |g, i|
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          #           result[g] ||= []
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                    result[g].push Prosumer.find(all_prosumers[i])
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                  puts "FITNESS: #{best.fitness}"
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  result.map.with_index do |c, i|
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                    puts "Cluster: #{c.map{|p| p.id}}"
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                    c.length > 0 ? get_penalty(c, ts, targets[i]) : 0
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                  end
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                end).transpose.map{|k| k.sum})
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                puts "audit: #{penalties_before}, #{penalties_after}"
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                # penalties_before.zip(penalties_after).map{|b,a| [b, a, (b-a)/b * 100]}
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                penalties_before.zip(penalties_after).map{|b,a| [b, a, a > 0 ? (b-a)/b * 100 : "NaN"]}
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
              end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
            end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          end
        
      194.

          1
          
              def run(kappa = 5)
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
                @lastRunSTats = {start_run: Time.now}
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          1
          
                puts "Beginning genetic search, please wait... "
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
                search = Ai4r::GeneticAlgorithm::GeneticSearchWithOptions.new(
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          440
          
                    @population_size, @generations, errors: @errors, prosumer_ids: @prosumers.map{|p| p.id}, kappa: kappa,
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                    penalty_violation: @penalty_violation,
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                    penalty_satisfaction: @penalty_satisfaction,
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                    class: @algorithm,
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                    stats: @lastRunSTats)
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          1
          
                best = search.run
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1
          
                puts "FITNESS #{best.fitness} CLUSTERS: "+
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          440
          
                         "#{best.data.zip(@prosumers).map {|c,p| [p.id, c]}}"
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
                result = []
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1
          
                best.data.each_with_index do |g, i|
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          440
          
                  result[g] ||= []
        
      61.

                def self.mutate(chromosome)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          20000
          
                  if chromosome.normalized_fitness && rand < ((1 - chromosome.normalized_fitness) * 0.3)
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                    data = chromosome.data
        
      204. 
      
        
    204.

                def self.reproduce(a, b)

      213.

              def cross_correlation(vector, pid1, pid2)
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
          
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          203172
          
                common_timestamps = @timestamps[pid1] & @timestamps[pid2]
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          1563156
          
                s12 = common_timestamps.sum{|ts| vector[[pid1, ts]] * vector[[pid2, ts]]}
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          1563156
          
                s11 = common_timestamps.sum{|ts| vector[[pid1, ts]] ** 2 }
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          1563156
          
                s22 = common_timestamps.sum{|ts| vector[[pid2, ts]] ** 2 }
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          203172
          
                return 0 if (s11 == 0 || s22 == 0)
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          8192
          
                s12 / ( s11 ** 0.5 * s22 ** 0.5)
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
              end
        
      75.

              def stats(clusters)
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          33
          
                sum_same = sum_different = 0.0;
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          33
          
                count_same = count_different = 0
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          33
          
                @prosumers.combination(2) do |pi,pj|
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          112452
          
                  i = @prosumers.index(pi)
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          112452
          
                  j = @prosumers.index(pj)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          112452
          
                  if same_cluster(clusters, i,j)
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          106287
          
                    sum_same += @similarity_matrix[i,j]
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          106287
          
                    count_same += 1
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  else
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          6165
          
                    sum_different += @similarity_matrix[i,j]
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          6165
          
                    count_different += 1
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                  end
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                end
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                {
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                    ingroup: sum_same / count_same,
        
      93.

      94.

              def same_cluster(clusters, i,j)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          408210
          
                clusters.find{|k| k.include? i} == clusters.find{|k| k.include? j}

              def initialize(similarity_matrix)
        
      8.

              def run(kappa = 5)
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                # v---- This is a "splat" operator
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1649
          
                degree_matrix = Matrix.diagonal *@similarity_matrix.row_vectors.map{|v| v.sum}
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          37
          
                unnormalized_laplacian = degree_matrix - @similarity_matrix
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          37
          
                decomposition = Matrix::EigenvalueDecomposition.new(unnormalized_laplacian)
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          37
          
                u = Matrix.columns(decomposition.eigenvectors.take(kappa))
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          37
          
                y = u.row_vectors
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                # puts decomposition.eigenvalues.take(kappa).join(",\n")
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                # puts decomposition.eigenvectors.take(kappa).join(",\n")
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                # puts u
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                # puts y.join(",\n")
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                # Use uniq to prevent duplicate vectors
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          10422
          
                clusters = y.uniq{|v| v.map{|j| j.round(0)}}.sample(kappa).map{|v| [y.index(v)]}
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          238
          
                centroids = clusters.map{ |cl| get_centroid(cl, y, y[0] - y[0]) }
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          37
          
                loop do
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  # puts "clusters: #{clusters}"
        
      36. 
      
        
    36.

                  break if centroids <=> old_centroids

              private
        
      57.

      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
              def get_centroid(cluster, y, old_centroid)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          98628
          
                (cluster.sum { |i| y[i] } + old_centroid) / (cluster.length + 1)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
              end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          1
          
              def find_closest(vector, centroids)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          551848
          
                centroids.index(centroids.min_by {|c| (c - vector).magnitude })
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
          
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            end

            class DemandResponseAgent

              def eligible_prosumers(feeder_id, prosumer_category_prosumers)

    16. 
          1

          module FetchAsynch
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # This class downloads prosumption data from the EDMS, and then inserts them
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # in the DB, and publishes the results to the appropriate rabbitMQ channel.

          1

          1
          
              def initialize(prosumers: Prosumer.real_time,
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                             interval: 3,
        
      14. 
      
        
    14.

    16.

                             threads: 1)

      27.

      28.

      29.

      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          8
          
                  begin
        
      34.

          8
          
                    ActiveRecord::Base.forbid_implicit_checkout_for_thread!

    35. 
          
          
          
        
      36.

      37.

          8
          
                    x = nil

          8

      39.

          8

    40. 
          8

    41. 
          
          
                    rescue Bunny::Exception # Don't block if channel can't be fanned out

      45.

    49. 
          8

          8
          
                      max_forc = (1.day / Interval.find(interval).duration.seconds).to_i

                      new_api_prosumer_ids.each do | pr_id |

                        thresh = Date.today.beginning_of_day.to_datetime

      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          
        
      91.

          39
          
                        if !only_missing || real_data_points_in_db[pr_id].nil? || real_data_points_in_db[pr_id] < max_points
        
      92.

          39
          
                          jobs.unshift params: params.merge(prosumers: pr_id, pointer: 2), api: :new
        
      93.

      94.

      99.

                        if forecasts

      102. 
      
        
    102.

      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          8
          
                    Parallel.each(jobs, in_threads: threads) do |job|
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          53
          
                      begin
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                        # sleep 1
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          53
          
                        case job[:api]
        
      127.

                          when :new
        
      128.

          45
          
                            raw = edms_rest_resource['getdataVGW'].get params: job[:params], :content_type => :json, :accept => :json
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                            # Rails.logger.debug "RAW: #{raw}"
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          45
          
                            result = JSON.parse raw
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                            # Rails.logger.debug "Result: #{result}"
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          45
          
                            result_conv = convert_new_to_old_api_v2 result, job[:params][:prosumers]
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                            #  Rails.logger.debug "Result_conv: #{result_conv}"
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          45
          
                            ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          45
          
                              x.publish({data:  "Interval #{@interval.name}: Processing results for prosumers: #{job[:params][:prosumers]}.", event: "output"}.to_json) if x
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          45
          
                              Rails.logger.debug "Interval #{@interval.name}: Processing results for prosumers: #{job[:params][:prosumers]}."
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                            end
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          45
          
                            datareceived(result_conv, x)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140.

                          when :fms
        
      141.

      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          5

      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                            result = JSON.parse raw
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                            datareceived_fms(result, x)
        
      145.

      146. 
      
        
    146.

      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          3

      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          3
          
                            result = JSON.parse(raw)
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                          # Rails.logger.debug "Result: #{result}"
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
          
        
      151.

          3
          
                            ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          3
          
                              x.publish({data:  "Interval #{@interval.name}: Processing results for prosumers: #{job[:params][:prosumers]}.", event: "output"}.to_json) if x
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          3
          
                              Rails.logger.debug "Interval #{@interval.name}: Processing results for prosumers: #{job[:params][:prosumers]}."
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                              end
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          3
          
                            datareceived(result, x)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156.

      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                      rescue Exception => e
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          5
          
                        Rails.logger.debug "EXCEPTION: #{e.inspect}"
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          5
          
                        puts "EXCEPTION: #{e.inspect}"
        
      160.

          5
          
                        Rails.logger.debug "MESSAGE: #{e.message}"
        
      161.

          5
          
                        puts "MESSAGE: #{e.message}"
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          5
          
                        Rails.logger.debug e.backtrace.join("\n")
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          5
          
                        puts e.backtrace.join("\n")
        
      164.

      165.

                    end
        
      166.

                    Rails.logger.debug "publshing market data"
        
      168.

                    begin
        
      169.

                      ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do

      172.

                                                                startDate: @startdate,
        
      173.

      174.

                                   event: 'market'}.to_json) if x

          8

                          x.publish({data:  "Interval #{@interval.name}: complete.", event: "output"}.to_json) if x
        
      178.

      179.

                      Rails.logger.debug "pushed end message"
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                    rescue Bunny::Exception # Don't block if channel can't be fanned out
        
      182.

                      Rails.logger.debug "Can't publish to channel #{channel}"
        
      183.

      184.

          8

      185.

          8

      186. 
      
        
    186.

                thread.join if (async)

          1
          
              private
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          1
          
              def datareceived_fms(data, x)
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                # Rails.logger.debug data
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do | conn |
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                  procs = Hash[@prosumers.map {|p| [p.edms_id, p]}]
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
          
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                    upsert_status = Upsert.batch(conn, Forecast.table_name) do |upsert|
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                      data["items"].each do | item |
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                        ts = item['timestamp'].sub(/:0.$/,'00').to_datetime - 3.hours
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
          
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                        if procs[item['prosumer_id'].to_s] && validate_timestamp(ts)
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                          # puts "Received: #{d}"
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                          selector = {
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                              timestamp: ts,
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                              prosumer_id: procs[item['prosumer_id'].to_s].id,
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                              interval_id: @interval.id,
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                              forecast_time: nil,
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                              forecast_type: 0
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                          }
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                          setter = {
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                              production: item['f_production'],
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                              consumption: item['f_consumption'],
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                              storage: item['f_storage'],
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                              created_at: DateTime.now,
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                              updated_at: DateTime.now
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                          }
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                          setter.reject!{|k,v| v.nil?}
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                          upsert.row(selector, setter)
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                        end
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                      end
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                    end
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                    x.publish({data:  "Interval #{@interval.name}: UPSERT status: #{upsert_status.count}", event: "output"}.to_json) if x
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                    Rails.logger.debug "Interval #{@interval.name}: UPSERT status: #{upsert_status.count}"
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                  rescue PG::InvalidTextRepresentation => e
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                    x.publish({data:  "Interval #{@interval.name}: BAD DATA FORMAT: #{upsert_status}", event: "output"}.to_json)
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                    # x.publish({data:  "BAD DATA FORMAT: #{data}", event: "output"}.to_json)
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                    Rails.logger.debug "Interval #{@interval.name}: BAD DATA FORMAT: #{upsert_status}"
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                    # Rails.logger.debug "BAD DATA FORMAT: #{data}"
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                    raise e
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                  end
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
          
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                    data = {}
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
          
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                    @prosumers.each do |pr|
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                      pr.reload
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                      pr.forecasts.reload
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                      data.merge!(pr.new_forecast(@interval, @startdate, @enddate))
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                    end
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                    # Rails.logger.debug "Sending FMS data: #{data}"
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                    x.publish(
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                        {
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                            data: data,
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                            event: 'fms_data'
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                        }.to_json
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                    ) unless x.nil?
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                  rescue Bunny::Exception # Don't block if channel can't be fanned out
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                    Rails.logger.debug "Can't publish to channel #{channel}"
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                  ensure
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                  end
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
          
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                end
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
              end
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
          
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          1
          
              def is_integer?(num)
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          84
          
                !!(num =~ /\A[-+]?[0-9]+\z/)
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              end
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
          
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          1
          
              def newAPI?(id)
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          84
          
                ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          84
          
                  (! is_integer?(id)) || (id.to_i > 100)
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                end
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              end
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
          
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          1
          
              def convert_new_to_old_api(data)
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                data.map do |d|
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                  {
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                      "timestamp" => d["Date"],
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                      "procumer_id" => d["Mac"],
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                      "interval" => @interval.duration,
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                      "actual" => {
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                          "production" => nil,
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                          "consumption" => d["Kwh"],
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                          "storage" => nil
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                      },
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                      "forecast" => {
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                          "timestamp" => "",
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                          "production" => nil,
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                          "consumption" => nil,
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                          "storage" => nil
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                      },
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                      "dr" => nil,
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                      "reliability" => nil
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                  } if is_integer? d["Kwh"].to_s
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                end.compact
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              end
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          1
          
              def hash_to_key_value(hash)
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          847
          
                key, value = hash.first
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
                [
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                    # DateTime.parse(key).to_s,
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          847
          
                    key,
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                    value.scan(/-?\d+[,.]?\d*/).first.gsub(/,/, ".").to_f
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
                ]
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
              end
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
          
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          1
          
              def empty_data_point_object(timestamp)
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                {
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                    "timestamp" => timestamp,
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                    "procumer_id" => nil,
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                    "interval" => @interval.duration,
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                    "actual" => {
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                        "production" => nil,
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
                        "consumption" => nil,
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
                        "storage" => nil
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                    },
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
                    "forecast" => {
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                        "timestamp" => "",
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
                        "production" => nil,
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
                        "consumption" => nil,
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
                        "storage" => nil
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
                    },
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
                    "dr" => nil,
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
                    "reliability" => nil
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          99
          
                }
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              end
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
          
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          1
          
              def validate_timestamp(timestamp)
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
          
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          847
          
                case @interval.duration
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                  when 900
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                    timestamp.to_datetime.to_i % 900 == 0
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                  when 3600
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          847
          
                    timestamp.to_datetime.to_i % 3600 == 0
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                  when 86400
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                    (DateTime.parse(timestamp).beginning_of_day + Time.zone.parse(timestamp).utc_offset.seconds) == (DateTime.parse(timestamp))
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
                end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
              end
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
          
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          1
          
              def validate_value(value)
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
          
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          847
          
                return true # Some values are just too large
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
          
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
                case @interval.duration
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
                  when 900
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
                    value < 500
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
                  when 3600
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
                    value < 2000
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
                  when 86400
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                    value < 30000
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                end
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
              end
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
          
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          1
          
              def parse_vals(result, intermediate_data, edms_key)
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          225
          
                return if result[edms_key].nil?
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          225
          
                result[edms_key].map(&method(:hash_to_key_value)).each do | key,value |
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          847
          
                  if validate_value(value) && validate_timestamp(key)
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          271
          
                    intermediate_data[key] ||= empty_data_point_object key
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          271
          
                    intermediate_data[key]["procumer_id"] = result["ProsumerId"]
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          271
          
                    res  = value.nil? ? nil : value.to_f
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          271
          
                    case edms_key
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
                      when "Production"
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          27
          
                        intermediate_data[key]["actual"]["production"] = res
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
                      when "Storage"
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          27
          
                        intermediate_data[key]["actual"]["storage"] = res
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
                      when "Consumption"
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          25
          
                        intermediate_data[key]["actual"]["consumption"] = res
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
                      when "Flexibility"
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          96
          
                        intermediate_data[key]["dr"] = res unless @interval.duration == 86400
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
                      when "Reliability"
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          96
          
                        intermediate_data[key]["reliability"] = res unless @interval.duration == 86400
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                    end
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                  end
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                end
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
              end
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
          
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          1
          
              def is_valid_iso8601(timestamp)
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                begin
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
                  Time.iso8601 timestamp
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                  return true
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
                rescue ArgumentError => e
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                  return false
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
                end
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
              end
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
          
        
      393. 
      
        
    393.

              def convert_new_to_old_api_v2(data, prosumer)

      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          45
          
                intermediate_data = {}

      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
          
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          45

      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
          
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
                # Rails.logger.debug result
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
          
        
      403. 
      
        
    403.

                %w[Production Storage Consumption Flexibility Reliability].each do |key|
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          225
          
                  parse_vals result, intermediate_data, key
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                end
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
          
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                result["ForecastConsumption"].map(&method(:hash_to_key_value)).each do | key,value |
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
          
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
                  key=key
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
                  # puts "@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ #{key.to_s}"
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
                  if @interval.duration == 86400 && !is_valid_iso8601(key)
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
                    # puts "@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ #{key}"
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
                    key = key.to_datetime.change(:offset => "+0200").to_s
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
                    # puts "@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ #{key}"
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                    key = (DateTime.parse(key).beginning_of_day + Time.zone.parse(key).utc_offset.seconds).to_s
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
                    # puts "@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ #{key}"
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
                  end
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
          
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
                  timestamp = case @interval.duration
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
                                when 900
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
                                  DateTime.parse(key) - 24.hours
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
                                when 3600
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
                                  (DateTime.parse(key) - 24.hours).beginning_of_hour
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
                                when 86400
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
                                  DateTime.parse(key).utc_offset == 7200 ? # Reject wrong timezones
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
                                      (DateTime.parse(key) - 24.hours).beginning_of_day + Time.zone.parse(key).utc_offset.seconds :
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
                                      nil
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
                              end
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
                  # Rails.logger.debug "ForecastConsumption: #{key}: #{DateTime.parse(key) - 24.hours} --- #{timestamp}"
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
          
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
                  if timestamp && validate_value(value)
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
                    intermediate_data[timestamp] ||= empty_data_point_object timestamp
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
                    intermediate_data[timestamp]["procumer_id"] = result["ProsumerId"]
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
                    intermediate_data[timestamp]["forecast"]["consumption"] ||= 0
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
                    intermediate_data[timestamp]["forecast"]["consumption"] += value.to_f unless value.nil?
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
                    intermediate_data[timestamp]["forecast"]["timestamp"] = timestamp + 24.hours
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
                    # puts "-------------> time: #{timestamp}  inter: #{intermediate_data[timestamp]["forecast"]["consumption"]}"
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
                  end
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          45
          
                end if result["ForecastConsumption"].length > 0
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
          
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
                result["ForecastProduction"].map(&method(:hash_to_key_value)).each do | key,value |
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
          
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
                  key=key
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
                  # puts "@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ #{key.to_s}"
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
                  if @interval.duration == 86400 && !is_valid_iso8601(key)
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
                    # puts "@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ #{key}"
        
      447.

      454.

      455.

    458.

                                  DateTime.parse(key).utc_offset == 7200 ? # Reject wrong timezones
        
      460.

                                      nil

      465.

          1
          
              def datareceived(data, x)
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
          
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
                # Rails.logger.debug "Finding existing datapoints"
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          48
          
                new_data_points = []
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          48
          
                procs = []
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
          
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          48
          
                Upsert.logger = Logger.new("/dev/null")
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
          
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          48
          
                ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool.with_connection do | conn |
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          1428
          
                  procs = Hash[@prosumers.map {|p| [p.edms_id, p]}]
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
          
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          48
          
                  begin
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          48
          
                    upsert_status = Upsert.batch(conn, DataPoint.table_name) do |upsert|
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          48
          
                      data.each do | d |
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
          
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          153
          
                        if procs[d['procumer_id'].to_s]
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
                          # puts "Received: #{d}"
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          153
          
                          selector = {
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
                              timestamp: d['timestamp'].to_datetime,
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
                              prosumer_id: procs[d['procumer_id'].to_s].id,
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
                              interval_id: @interval.id
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
                          }
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
          
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          153
          
                          setter = {
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
                              production: d['actual']['production'],
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
                              consumption: d['actual']['consumption'],
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
                              storage: d['actual']['storage'],
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
                              f_timestamp: d['forecast']['timestamp'].to_datetime,
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
                              f_production: d['forecast']['production'],
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
                              f_consumption: d['forecast']['consumption'],
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
                              f_storage: d['forecast']['storage'],
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
                              dr: d['dr'],
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
                              reliability: d['reliability']
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
                          }
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
          
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          1530
          
                          setter.reject!{|k,v| v.nil?}
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
          
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          153
          
                          upsert.row(selector, setter) if valid_time_stamp d['timestamp']
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
                        end
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
                      end
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
                    end
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          48
          
                    x.publish({data:  "Interval #{@interval.name}: UPSERT status: #{upsert_status.count}", event: "output"}.to_json) if x
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          48
          
                    Rails.logger.debug "Interval #{@interval.name}: UPSERT status: #{upsert_status.count}"
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
                  rescue PG::InvalidTextRepresentation => e
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
                    x.publish({data:  "Interval #{@interval.name}: BAD DATA FORMAT: #{upsert_status}", event: "output"}.to_json)
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
                    # x.publish({data:  "BAD DATA FORMAT: #{data}", event: "output"}.to_json)
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
                    Rails.logger.debug "Interval #{@interval.name}: BAD DATA FORMAT: #{upsert_status}"
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
                    # Rails.logger.debug "BAD DATA FORMAT: #{data}"
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
                    raise e
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
                  end
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
          
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
          
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
          
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
          
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          48
          
                  new_data_points = data.reject do |d|
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          153
          
                    !valid_time_stamp(d['timestamp']) || d['timestamp'].to_datetime.future?
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
                  end
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
          
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
                end
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          
          
          
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          48
          
                begin
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          48
          
                  message = new_data_points.map do |d|
        
      542. 
      
        
    542. 
          151
          
                    prepare(d, procs)
        
      543. 
      
        
    543. 
          
          
                  end.compact
        
      544. 
      
        
    544. 
          48
          
                  x.publish({data: message, event: 'datapoints'}.to_json) unless x.nil?
        
      545. 
      
        
    545. 
          
          
                rescue Bunny::Exception # Don't block if channel can't be fanned out
        
      546. 
      
        
    546. 
          
          
                  Rails.logger.debug "Can't publish to channel #{channel}"
        
      547. 
      
        
    547. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      548. 
      
        
    548. 
          48
          
                end
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          
          
              end
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
          
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          1
          
              def db_prepare(d, procs)
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          
          
               DataPoint.new(
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          
          
                  timestamp: d['timestamp'].to_datetime,
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
                  prosumer: procs[d['procumer_id'].to_s],
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
                  interval: @interval,
        
      556. 
      
        
    556. 
          
          
                  production: d['actual']['production'],
        
      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
                  consumption: d['actual']['consumption'],
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
                  storage: d['actual']['storage'],
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
                  f_timestamp: d['forecast']['timestamp'].to_datetime,
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
                  f_production: d['forecast']['production'],
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
                  f_consumption: d['forecast']['consumption'],
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
                  f_storage: d['forecast']['storage'],
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
                  dr: d['dr'],
        
      564. 
      
        
    564. 
          
          
                  reliability: d['reliability']
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
               )
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
              end
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          
          
          
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          1
          
              def prepare(d, procs)
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
          
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          151
          
                if procs[d['procumer_id'].to_s]
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          151
          
                  k = d.deep_dup
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
          
        
      573. 
      
        
    573. 
          151
          
                  k['timestamp'] = d['timestamp'].to_datetime.to_i
        
      574. 
      
        
    574. 
          151
          
                  k['prosumer_id'] = procs[d['procumer_id'].to_s].id
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          151
          
                  k['prosumer_name'] = procs[d['procumer_id'].to_s].name
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          151
          
                  k['forecast']['timestamp'] =
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
                      d['forecast']['timestamp'].to_datetime.to_i
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          151
          
                  k['actual']['prosumption'] = prosumption(d['actual']['consumption'], d['actual']['production'])
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          151
          
                  k['forecast']['prosumption'] = prosumption(d['forecast']['consumption'], d['forecast']['production'])
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          151
          
                  return k
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
                else
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          
          
                  return nil
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
                end
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
              end
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
          
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          1
          
              def prosumption(consumption, production)
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          302
          
                return nil if consumption.nil? && production.nil?
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          132
          
                consumption.to_f - production.to_f
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
              end
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
          
        
      591. 
      
        
    591. 
          1
          
              def valid_time_stamp(str)
        
      592. 
      
        
    592. 
          306
          
                Time.iso8601(str.to_s)
        
      593. 
      
        
    593. 
          306
          
                return true
        
      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError => e
        
      595. 
      
        
    595. 
          
          
                Rails.logger.debug "Received junk input: #{str}"
        
      596. 
      
        
    596. 
          
          
                return false
        
      597. 
      
        
    597. 
          
          
              end
        
      598.

          module HierMenu
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
            # This class is used for creating a hierarchical menu
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
            # with simple-navigation. The module will add an collection
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
            # of models, and will split it hierarchically so that the
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            # number of children are limited.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
            class HierMenu
        
      7.

          1
          
              def initialize(menu_id, # A unique string used as the element id
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
                             url_proc, # a Proc that returns the url of the object
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                             diplay_property = nil, # The property that wiil be used
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                             #                        as the title in the menu
        
      11. 
      
        
    11.

      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                #                             each element
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          327
          
                @item_id = 0

          327

              def fill_node(nav_item, collection, level = 3)

    22. 
          1220
          
                if collection.count < @max_width

          674

    24.

          973

              def menu_add_collection(nav_item, slice, level)

              def slice_size(num_items)

                result = 1

          973

          1347

              def calcCosts

                forecast_cache = {}

          15

                              data: forecast.map do |f|
        
      109.

          1661

      111.

      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          1661

              def forecast

              def sum_cost

      241.

      242.

      244.

                    .select("timestamp, prosumer_id, COALESCE(consumption,0) - COALESCE(production,0) as prosumption")
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                    .inject({}) do |sum, dp|
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          21582
          
                  sum[dp.timestamp.to_i] ||= 0
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          21582

      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          21582
          
                      (real_cost(dp, {

      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          21582
          
                  sum
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          9337
          
                end.map {|k,v| [k*1000,v]}.sort {|a,b| a[0] <=> b[0]}
        
      254.

      255.

      256.

          1
          
              def real_cost(f, forecasts, prices)
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          68302
          
                forecasts ||= {}
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          68302
          
                forecasts[f.timestamp.to_i] ||= 0
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          68302
          
                prices[f.timestamp.to_i] ||= 0
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
               #  puts "testing: #{f.prosumption}, #{prices[f.timestamp.to_i]}, #{forecasts[f.timestamp.to_i]}, #{f.prosumption * prices[f.timestamp.to_i] +
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
               #      (forecasts[f.timestamp.to_i] - f.prosumption) * @penalty_satisfaction * real_price(f.timestamp)}"
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          68302
          
                return 0 if f.prosumption.nil?
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          68302
          
                f.prosumption > forecasts[f.timestamp.to_i] ?
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                      forecasts[f.timestamp.to_i] * prices[f.timestamp.to_i] +
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          50040
          
                          (f.prosumption - forecasts[f.timestamp.to_i]) * (1 + @penalty_violation) * real_price(f.timestamp) :
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                      f.prosumption * prices[f.timestamp.to_i] +
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          18262
          
                          (forecasts[f.timestamp.to_i] - f.prosumption) * @penalty_satisfaction * real_price(f.timestamp)
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
              end
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          1
          
              def penalty_for_single(day_ahead_amount)
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                # day_ahead_cost = day_ahead_amount * real_price(@startDate)
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
          
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                f = real()
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
          
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                raise "Multiple Results" if f.length > 1
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
          
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                f = [ Struct.new(:timestamp, :prosumption).new(@startDate, 0) ] if f.length == 0
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
          
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                actual_amount = f.first.prosumption
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
          
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                #final_cost = real_cost(f.first,
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                #                       {@startDate.to_i => day_ahead_amount},
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                #                       {@startDate.to_i => real_price(@startDate)})
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
          
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                #final_cost - day_ahead_cost
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
          
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                imbalance = day_ahead_amount - actual_amount
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
          
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                (imbalance > 0 ? @penalty_satisfaction : - @penalty_violation) * imbalance * real_price(@startDate)
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
          
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              end
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
          
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          1
          
              def real_price(cons_timestamp)
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          186050
          
                @real_price_cache ||= Hash[DayAheadEnergyPrice.where(date: (@startDate - 365.days - 1.day - 2.hours) .. (@endDate - 365.days), region_id: 1).map { |d| [(d.date.to_datetime + 365.days + d.dayhour.hours).to_i, d.price * 0.001 ] }] # Convert euro/MWh to euro/KWh
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                # Rails.logger.debug "ts: #{cons_timestamp}, Cache: #{@real_price_cache}"
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          183324
          
                @real_price_cache[cons_timestamp.to_i] ||= 0
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
              end
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
          
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          1
          
              def forecast_price(cons_timestamp, fore_timestamp)
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          25544
          
                @forecast_price_cache ||= Hash[DayAheadEnergyPrice.where(date: (@startDate - 365.days - 1.day - 2.hours) .. (@endDate - 365.days), region_id: 1).map { |d| [(d.date.to_datetime + 365.days + d.dayhour.hours).to_i, d.price * 0.001 ] }] # Convert euro/MWh to euro/KWh      puts "timestamp: #{cons_timestamp}, price: #{@forecast_price_cache[cons_timestamp.to_i]}, total: #{@forecast_price_cache}"
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              #   Rails.logger.debug "ts: #{cons_timestamp}, For. Cache: #{@forecast_price_cache}, startDate: #{@startDate}, endDate: #{@endDate}"
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          22938
          
                @forecast_price_cache[cons_timestamp.to_i]
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              end
        
      305. 
      
        
    305.

              def initialize io

              def write object, options = {}
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                options.each do |k,v|
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                  @io.write "#{k}: #{v}\n"

    14.

    test/controllers/data_points_controller_test.rb

    100.0 % covered

            test "index with token authentication via query params" do

          1
          
              users(:one)

          1
          
              sign_out User.first

    66. 
          1
          
              get :index, { user_email: users(:one).email, user_token: users(:one).authentication_token, format: :json }
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
              # puts @request.parameters
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
              # puts @response.body
        
      69.

          1
